page.title: 20TRANSPORT PROBLEMS
page.content: 50 years ago, people here used the few single track roads on foot. Today, cars are an essential for use on the modern roads which have been rebuilt over the last decade. The nearest rail centre is Lairg 50 miles to the East. Our mail & passengers come here on the daily Mail bus. However, fuel is costly, resulting in expensive food and other essentials. We are lucky enough to have a port here and many boats use this for landing their catches or refuelling. The fish catches are transported by road to the major markets of Aberdeen & England. There is no provision for aircraft of any description but there are one or two emergency landing pads for helicopters which have been used in times of bad weather.
